New Records: Cleveland's bullpen combined for 4 1/3 hitless innings to finish, matching the largest shutout victory margin in club postseason history
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas hit a three-run homer in a five-run outburst before Detroit got an out
Tanner Bibee pitched 4 2/3 innings before handing the ball to the bullpen
Cade Smith struck out all four batters in his relief appearance
Pre-Game Insights: The 2,327th meeting between Detroit and Cleveland was the first between the franchises and Central division rivals in the postseason
Hinch used his bullpen in Game 1 from the start and it backfired
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland's bullpen was as advertised, with rookie Cade Smith striking out all four batters and Tim Herrin, Hunter Gaddis, and Emmanuel Clase combining for 4 1/3 hitless innings
The Tigers were shut out for the worst in Detroit playoff history since Game 1 of the 1945 World Series
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of 33,548 fans at Progressive Field
The Guardians were unaffected by not playing for almost a week with a first-round bye
Game 2 is Monday, when the Tigers will turn to Tarik Skubal to try and even the best-of-five series
Others: RHP Alex Cobb was added to the ALDS roster after finishing the regular season on the injured list with a blister on his middle finger
Matthew Boyd is expected to face Tarik Skubal in Game 2
